  35 -def find_nullclines(gen, xname, yname, x_dom=None, y_dom=None, fps=None, n=10, 
  36                      t=0, xtol=None, fixed_vars=None, jac=None, max_step=0, 
  37                      max_num_points=1000, only_var=None, 
  38                      newfig=True, colx='b', coly='r', plot_style='-', doplot=True): 

  39      """Find nullclines of a two-dimensional sub-system of the given 
  40      Generator object gen, specified by xname and yname. Plots will use 
  41      color blue for xname and r for yname by default, and require pylab. 
  42   
  43      Inputs: 
  44   
  45      gen is a Generator object 
  46      xname, yname are state variable names of gen 
  47   
  48      Optional inputs: 
  49   
  50      Restriction of x and y to sub-domains can be made using x_dom and y_dom 
  51      lists of [min, max] values (default to domains given in generator). 
  52   
  53      Setting of unused variables that are fixed for 2D nullclines can be given 
  54        by the dict or Point fixed_vars, otherwise the Generator's initial 
  55        conditions will be used. 
  56   
  57      n = initial number of meshpoints for fsolve. Don't set this large if using 
  58        PyCont, e.g. use n=3. Default is 10. 
  59   
  60      Set t value for non-autonomous systems (default 0). Support for Jacobians 
  61        with non-autonomous systems is not yet provided. 
  62   
  63      jac is a Jacobian function that accepts keyword arguments including t for 
  64        time (even if Jacobian is time-independent). 
  65   
  66      max_step (dictionary) tells PyCont the largest step size to use for each 
  67        variable. Integer 0 (default) switches off PyCont use. Use None 
  68        to tell PyCont to use default max step size (5e-1). 
  69   
  70      fps can be a list of points previously calculated to be fixed points, 
  71        which this function will use as additional starting points for 
  72        computation. 
  73   
  74      xtol sets the accuracy to which the nullclines are calculated. Default is 
  75        approx. 1e-8. 
  76   
  77      colx, coly set the colours for the nullclines (default 'b', 'r', 
  78        respectively) 
  79   
  80      only_var (variable name) requests that only the nullcline for that variable 
  81        will be computed. The variable name must correspond to xname or yname. 
  82   
  83   
  84      Output: 
  85          (x_null, y_null, (fig_handle,nx_handle,ny_handle)) 
  86      where the handles will be null if doplot=False, or fig_handle=None 
  87      if newfig=False. 
  88   
  89      Note that the points returned are not guaranteed to be in any particular 
  90      order. 
  91      """ 
  92      vardict = filteredDict(copy(gen.initialconditions), gen.funcspec.vars) 
  93      if fixed_vars is not None: 
  94          vardict.update(filteredDict(gen._FScompatibleNames(dict(fixed_vars)), 
  95                          remain(gen.funcspec.vars, [xname, yname]))) 
  96      var_ix_map = invertMap(gen.funcspec.vars) 
  97      max_step = gen._FScompatibleNames(max_step) 
  98      xname_orig = gen._FScompatibleNamesInv(xname) 
  99      yname_orig = gen._FScompatibleNamesInv(yname) 
 100      xname = gen._FScompatibleNames(xname) 
 101      yname = gen._FScompatibleNames(yname) 
 102      if only_var is None: 
 103          do_vars = [xname, yname] 
 104      else: 
 105          assert only_var in [xname, yname], "only_var must be one of xname or yname" 
 106          do_vars = [only_var] 
 107      x_ix = var_ix_map[xname] 
 108      y_ix = var_ix_map[yname] 
 109      pp_vars = [xname, yname] 
 110      pp_vars.sort() 
 111      pp_var_ix_map = invertMap(pp_vars) 
 112      def xdot_x(x, y, t): 
 113          vardict[yname] = y 
 114          vardict[xname] = x 
 115          return gen.Rhs(t,vardict,gen.pars)[x_ix] 

 116      def ydot_y(y, x, t): 
 117          vardict[yname] = y 
 118          vardict[xname] = x 
 119          return gen.Rhs(t,vardict,gen.pars)[y_ix] 
 120      def xdot_y(x, y, t): 
 121          vardict[yname] = y 
 122          vardict[xname] = x 
 123          return gen.Rhs(t,vardict,gen.pars)[y_ix] 
 124      def ydot_x(y, x, t): 
 125          vardict[yname] = y 
 126          vardict[xname] = x 
 127          return gen.Rhs(t,vardict,gen.pars)[x_ix] 
 128      if x_dom is None and xname in do_vars: 
 129          x_dom = gen.xdomain[xname] 
 130          if not (isfinite(x_dom[0]) and isfinite(x_dom[1])): 
 131              raise PyDSTool_ExistError("Must specify finite range for %s"%xname) 
 132      if y_dom is None and yname in do_vars: 
 133          y_dom = gen.xdomain[yname]

 135              raise PyDSTool_ExistError("Must specify finite range for %s"%yname) 
 136      if gen.haveJacobian():

 138          def xfprime_x(x, y, t):

 140              vardict[yname] = y

 148              vardict[yname] = y

 150          def yfprime_y(y, x, t): 
 151              vardict[xname] = x 
 152              vardict[yname] = y 
 153              return gen.Jacobian(t, vardict, gen.pars)[y_ix] 
 154      elif jac is not None: 
 155          # assumes **args-compatible signature! 
 156          xix = pp_var_ix_map[xname] 
 157          yix = pp_var_ix_map[yname] 
 158          # x will be first argument to these 
 159          xfprime_x = lambda x, y, t: array(jac(**{'t': t, xname: x, 
 160                                        yname: y})[xix]) 
 161          xfprime_y = lambda x, y, t: array(jac(**{'t': t, xname: x, 
 162                                        yname: y})[yix]) 
 163          # y will be first argument to these 
 164          yfprime_x = lambda y, x, t: array(jac(**{'t': t, xname: x, 
 165                                        yname: y})[xix]) 
 166          yfprime_y = lambda y, x, t: array(jac(**{'t': t, xname: x,

 168      else:

 170          xfprime_y = None 
 171          yfprime_x = None

 173      if xtol is None:

 177      x_null_pts = []

 179      if fps is not None:

 181          add_pts_x = [fp[xname] for fp in fps_FS] 
 182          add_pts_y = [fp[yname] for fp in fps_FS] 
 183      else: 
 184          add_pts_x = [] 
 185          add_pts_y = [] 
 186      rout = redirc.Redirector(redirc.STDOUT) 
 187      rout.start() 
 188      if yname in do_vars: 
 189          for x0 in add_pts_x + x_range[::int(ceil(n/10.))]: 
 190              try: 
 191                  y_null_pts.extend([(_xinf_ND(xdot_y,x0,args=(y,t), 
 192                                 xddot=xfprime_y,xtol=xtol),y) for y in y_range]) 
 193                  y_null_pts.extend([(x0,_xinf_ND(ydot_y,y,args=(x0,t), 
 194                                 xddot=yfprime_y,xtol=xtol)) for y in y_range]) 
 195              except (OverflowError, ZeroDivisionError): 
 196                  rout.stop() 
 197              except: 
 198                  rout.stop() 
 199                  raise 
 200      if xname in do_vars: 
 201          for y0 in add_pts_y + y_range[::int(ceil(n/10.))]: 
 202              try: 
 203                  x_null_pts.extend([(x,_xinf_ND(ydot_x,y0,args=(x,t), 
 204                                 xddot=yfprime_x,xtol=xtol)) for x in x_range]) 
 205                  x_null_pts.extend([(_xinf_ND(xdot_x,x,args=(y0,t), 
 206                                 xddot=xfprime_x,xtol=xtol),y0) for x in x_range]) 
 207              except (OverflowError, ZeroDivisionError): 
 208                  rout.stop() 
 209              except: 
 210                  rout.stop() 
 211                  raise 
 212      rout.stop() 
 213      # 5% tolerance outside domain for keeping points in nullclines 
 214      # final points will be cropped to domain with this tolerance 
 215      tol = 0.02 
 216      xwidth = abs(x_dom[1]-x_dom[0]) 
 217      ywidth = abs(y_dom[1]-y_dom[0]) 
 218      xinterval=Interval('xdom', float, [x_dom[0]-tol*xwidth, x_dom[1]+tol*xwidth]) 
 219      yinterval=Interval('ydom', float, [y_dom[0]-tol*ywidth, y_dom[1]+tol*ywidth]) 
 220      x_null = filter_close_points(crop_2D(filter_NaN(x_null_pts), 
 221                                  xinterval, yinterval), xtol*10) 
 222      y_null = filter_close_points(crop_2D(filter_NaN(y_null_pts), 
 223                                  xinterval, yinterval), xtol*10) 
 224      if max_step == 0: 
 225          # do not use PyCont to improve accuracy 
 226          # Also, points are not necessarily in order so don't plot with lines 
 227          plot_type = '.' 
 228      else: 
 229          # use PyCont to improve accuracy 
 230          # PyCont will order the points so can draw lines 
 231          plot_type = plot_style 
 232          loop_step = 5 
 233          # current limitation! 
 234          # pycont won't find disconnected branches of nullclines so we have to seed 
 235          # with multiple starting points 
 236          # - also, the following assumes more than one point was already added to 
 237          # these lists 
 238          # Y 
 239          if yname in do_vars: 
 240              if len(y_null) > 1: 
 241                  x_init = y_null[1,0] 
 242                  y_init = y_null[1,1] 
 243              elif len(y_null) == 1: 
 244                  x_init = y_null[0,0] 
 245                  y_init = y_null[0,1] 
 246              elif fps is not None and len(fps) > 0: 
 247                  x_init = fps[0][xname_orig] + 1e-5 
 248                  y_init = fps[0][yname_orig] + 1e-5 
 249              else: 
 250                  x_init = (x_dom[0]+x_dom[1])/2. 
 251                  y_init = (y_dom[0]+y_dom[1])/2. 
 252              if x_init < x_dom[0]: 
 253                  x_init = x_dom[0] 
 254              elif x_init > x_dom[1]: 
 255                  x_init = x_dom[1] 
 256              if y_init < y_dom[0]: 
 257                  y_init = y_dom[0] 
 258              elif y_init > y_dom[1]: 
 259                  y_init = y_dom[1] 
 260              sysargs_y = args(name='nulls_y', pars={xname: x_init}, 
 261                             ics={yname: y_init}, 
 262                             varspecs={yname: gen.funcspec._initargs['varspecs'][yname]}, 
 263                             xdomain={yname: y_dom}, pdomain={xname: x_dom}) 
 264              if 'inputs' in gen.funcspec._initargs: # and isinstance(gen.funcspec._initargs['inputs'], dict): 
 265                  if len(gen.funcspec._initargs['inputs']) > 0: 
 266                      sysargs_y['inputs'] = gen.inputs.copy() 
 267              if 'fnspecs' in gen.funcspec._initargs: 
 268                  sysargs_y.update({'fnspecs':renameClashingAuxFnPars(gen.funcspec._initargs['fnspecs'], [xname])}) 
 269              sysargs_y.pars.update(gen.pars) 
 270              sysargs_y.pars.update(filteredDict(vardict, [xname, yname], neg=True)) 
 271              sysargs_y.pars['time'] = t 
 272              sys_y = Vode_ODEsystem(sysargs_y) 
 273              P = ContClass(sys_y) 
 274              PCargs = args(name='null_curve_y', type='EP-C') 
 275              PCargs.freepars = [xname] 
 276              PCargs.MinStepSize = 1e-4 
 277              PCargs.VarTol = PCargs.FuncTol = 1e-4 
 278              PCargs.TestTol = 1e-3 
 279              if max_step is None: 
 280                  PCargs.MaxStepSize = 5e-1 
 281                  PCargs.StepSize = 1e-2 
 282              else: 
 283                  PCargs.MaxStepSize = max_step[xname] 
 284                  PCargs.StepSize = max_step[xname]/2 
 285              PCargs.MaxNumPoints = loop_step 
 286              P.newCurve(PCargs) 
 287              # check every loop_step points until go out of bounds 
 288              done = False 
 289              num_points = 0 
 290              while not done: 
 291                  try: 
 292                      P['null_curve_y'].forward() 
 293                  except PyDSTool_ExistError: 
 294                      print 'null_curve_y failed in forward direction' 
 295                      raise 
 296                  else: 
 297                      num_points += loop_step 
 298                      done = not check_bounds(array([P['null_curve_y'].new_sol_segment[xname], 
 299                                                    P['null_curve_y'].new_sol_segment[yname]]).T, 
 300                                              xinterval, yinterval) \ 
 301                            or num_points > max_num_points 
 302              done = False 
 303              num_points = 0 
 304              while not done: 
 305                  try: 
 306                      P['null_curve_y'].backward() 
 307                  except PyDSTool_ExistError: 
 308                      print 'null_curve_y failed in backward direction' 
 309                      raise 
 310                  else: 
 311                      num_points += loop_step 
 312                      done = not check_bounds(array([P['null_curve_y'].new_sol_segment[xname], 
 313                                                    P['null_curve_y'].new_sol_segment[yname]]).T, 
 314                                              xinterval, yinterval) \ 
 315                           or num_points > max_num_points 
 316              y_null = crop_2D(array([P['null_curve_y'].sol[xname], 
 317                                      P['null_curve_y'].sol[yname]]).T, 
 318                               xinterval, yinterval) 
 319          # X 
 320          if xname in do_vars: 
 321              if len(x_null) > 1: 
 322                  x_init = x_null[1,0] 
 323                  y_init = x_null[1,1] 
 324              elif len(x_null) == 1: 
 325                  x_init = x_null[0,0] 
 326                  y_init = x_null[0,1] 
 327              elif fps is not None and len(fps) > 0: 
 328                  x_init = fps[0][xname_orig] + 1e-5 
 329                  y_init = fps[0][yname_orig] + 1e-5 
 330              else: 
 331                  x_init = (x_dom[0]+x_dom[1])/2. 
 332                  y_init = (y_dom[0]+y_dom[1])/2. 
 333              if x_init < x_dom[0]: 
 334                  x_init = x_dom[0] 
 335              elif x_init > x_dom[1]: 
 336                  x_init = x_dom[1] 
 337              if y_init < y_dom[0]: 
 338                  y_init = y_dom[0] 
 339              elif y_init > y_dom[1]: 
 340                  y_init = y_dom[1] 
 341              sysargs_x = args(name='nulls_x', pars={yname: y_init}, 
 342                             ics={xname: x_init}, tdata=[t,t+1], 
 343                             varspecs={xname: gen.funcspec._initargs['varspecs'][xname]}, 
 344                             xdomain={xname: x_dom}, pdomain={yname: y_dom}) 
 345              if 'inputs' in gen.funcspec._initargs: # and isinstance(gen.funcspec._initargs['inputs'], dict): 
 346                  if len(gen.funcspec._initargs['inputs']) > 0: 
 347                      sysargs_x['inputs'] = gen.inputs.copy() 
 348              if 'fnspecs' in gen.funcspec._initargs: 
 349                  sysargs_x.update({'fnspecs': renameClashingAuxFnPars(gen.funcspec._initargs['fnspecs'], [yname])}) 
 350              sysargs_x.pars.update(gen.pars) 
 351              sysargs_x.pars.update(filteredDict(vardict, [xname, yname], neg=True)) 
 352              sysargs_x.pars['time'] = t 
 353              sys_x = Vode_ODEsystem(sysargs_x) 
 354              P = ContClass(sys_x) 
 355              PCargs = args(name='null_curve_x', type='EP-C') 
 356              PCargs.freepars = [yname] 
 357              PCargs.MinStepSize = 1e-4 
 358              PCargs.VarTol = PCargs.FuncTol = 1e-4 
 359              PCargs.TestTol = 1e-3 
 360              if max_step is None: 
 361                  PCargs.MaxStepSize = 5e-1 
 362                  PCargs.StepSize = 1e-2 
 363              else: 
 364                  PCargs.MaxStepSize = max_step[yname] 
 365                  PCargs.StepSize = max_step[yname]/2 
 366              PCargs.MaxNumPoints = loop_step 
 367              P.newCurve(PCargs) 
 368              done = False 
 369              num_points = 0 
 370              while not done: 
 371                  try: 
 372                      P['null_curve_x'].forward()

 374                      print 'null_curve_x failed in forward direction'

 376                  else: 
 377                      num_points += loop_step 
 378                      done = not check_bounds(array([P['null_curve_x'].new_sol_segment[xname],

 425 -def find_fixedpoints(gen, subdomain=None, n=5, maxsearch=1e3, eps=1e-8, 
 426                       t=0, jac=None): 

 427      """Find fixed points of a system in a given domain, 
 428      on the assumption that they are isolated points. 
 429   
 430      Set t value for non-autonomous systems (default 0). 
 431      """ 
 432      # get state variable domains if subdomain dictionary not given 
 433      if subdomain is None: 
 434          subdomain = filteredDict(gen.xdomain, gen.funcspec.vars) 
 435      else: 
 436          subdomain = gen._FScompatibleNames(subdomain) 
 437          assert remain(subdomain.keys(),gen.funcspec.vars) == [] and \ 
 438                 remain(gen.funcspec.vars,subdomain.keys()) == [] 
 439      # only vary over domains that are given as ranges: fixed values 
 440      # are not counted 
 441      D = 0 
 442      xdict = {}.fromkeys(gen.funcspec.vars) 
 443      fixed_vars = {} 
 444      for xname, dom in subdomain.iteritems(): 
 445          if isinstance(dom, (tuple,list)): 
 446              if not (isfinite(dom[0]) and isfinite(dom[1])): 
 447                  raise RuntimeError("Must specify a finite range for %s"%xname) 
 448              D += 1 
 449          else: 
 450              xdict[xname] = dom 
 451              # put fixed vars back into return value 
 452              fixed_vars[xname] = dom 
 453      var_ix_map = invertMap(gen.funcspec.vars) 
 454      # pick n uniformly distributed starting points in domains, 
 455      # ensuring n isn't so large as to require more than maxsearch 
 456      # number of searches 
 457      while True: 
 458          if n**D > maxsearch: 
 459              n = n-1 
 460          else: 
 461              break 
 462          if n < 3: 
 463              raise "maxsearch too small" 
 464      # NOTE: def Rhs(self, t, xdict, pdict) and Jacobian signature 
 465      # has same form, so need to use a wrapper function to convert order 
 466      # of arguments to suit solver. 
 467      # 
 468      def Rhs_wrap(x, t, pdict): 
 469          xdict.update(dict(zip(x0_names, x))) 
 470          try: 
 471              return take(gen.Rhs(t, xdict, pdict), x0_ixs) 
 472          except (OverflowError, ValueError): 
 473              return array([1e4]*D) 

 474      if gen.haveJacobian(): 
 475          def Jac_wrap(x, t, pdict): 
 476              xdict.update(dict(zip(x0_names, x))) 
 477              try: 
 478                  return take(take(gen.Jacobian(t, xdict, pdict), x0_ixs,0), x0_ixs,1) 
 479              except (OverflowError, ValueError): 
 480                  # penalty 
 481                  return array([[1e4]*D]*D) 
 482          fprime = Jac_wrap 
 483      elif jac is not None: 
 484          def Jac_wrap(x, t, pdict): 
 485              xdict.update(dict(zip(x0_names, x))) 
 486              argdict = filteredDict(xdict, jac._args) 
 487              argdict['t'] = t 
 488              try: 
 489                  return array(jac(**argdict)) 
 490              except (OverflowError, ValueError): 
 491                  # penalty 
 492                  return array([[1e4]*D]*D) 
 493          fprime = Jac_wrap 
 494      else: 
 495          fprime = None 
 496      # solve xdot on each starting point 
 497      fps = [] 
 498      fp_listdict = [] 
 499      x0_coords = zeros((D,n),'f') 
 500      x0_ixs = [] 
 501      x0_names = [] 
 502      ix = 0 
 503      # sort names by key to ensure same ordering as generator variables 
 504      for xname, xdom in sortedDictItems(subdomain,byvalue=False): 
 505          if isinstance(xdom, (tuple, list)): 
 506              x0_ixs.append(var_ix_map[xname]) 
 507              x0_names.append(xname) 
 508              x0_coords[ix,:] = linspace(xdom[0], xdom[1], n) 
 509              ix += 1 
 510      d_posns = base_n_counter(n,D) 
 511      xtol = eps/10. 
 512      for dummy_ix in xrange(n**D): 
 513          x0 = array([x0_coords[i][d_posns[i]] for i in xrange(D)]) 
 514          res = fsolve(Rhs_wrap,x0,(t,gen.pars),xtol=xtol, 
 515                            fprime=fprime,full_output=True) 
 516          xinf_val = res[0] 
 517          # treat f.p.s within epsilon (2-norm) of each other as identical 
 518          if alltrue(isfinite(xinf_val)): 
 519              if len(fps) == 0 or not sometrue([norm(fp-xinf_val)<eps for fp in fps]): 
 520                  ok = res[2]==1 
 521                  # check that bounds were met 
 522                  if ok: 
 523                      for ix, xname in enumerate(x0_names): 
 524                          ok = ok and \

 615 -def bisection(func, a, b, args=(), xtol=1e-10, maxiter=400, normord=2): 

 616      """Bisection root-finding method.  Given a function returning +/- 1 
 617      and an interval with func(a) * func(b) < 0, find the root between a and b. 
 618   
 619      Variant of scipy.optimize.minpack.bisection with exception for too many iterations 
 620      """ 
 621      eva = func(a,*args) 
 622      evb = func(b,*args) 
 623      assert (eva*evb < 0), "Must start with interval with func(a) * func(b) <0" 
 624      i = 1 
 625      while i<=maxiter: 
 626          dist = (b-a)/2.0 
 627          p = a + dist 
 628          if norm(dist,normord) < xtol: 
 629              return p 
 630          try: 
 631              ev = func(p,*args) 
 632          except RuntimeError: 
 633              return p 
 634          if ev == 0: 
 635              return p 
 636          i += 1 
 637          if ev*eva > 0: 
 638              a = p 
 639              eva = ev 
 640          else: 
 641              b = p 
 642      raise RuntimeError("Method failed after %d iterations." % maxiter)
